qas.question: What sub-genre of hard rock does Def Leppard belong to?

answers.text: the New Wave of British Heavy Metal

qas.question: What was Def Leppard's second album called?
What were the three Top 40 singles from Def Leppard's Pyromania album?
What band had the first glam metal album to hit number one on the Billboard charts?
When did Motley Crue's album Shout At The Devil come out?
Who is often categorized with the New Wave of American Heavy Metal?
What is the first album released by Def Leppard?
What Def Leppard album reached number two on the British music charts?
When did the band Ratt release their Too Fast for Love album?
What was the name of the 1983 Twisted Sister album that reached number one on the Billboard music charts?

context: Often categorised with <a0_0>the New Wave of British Heavy Metal<a0_0/>, in 1981 <b5_0>Def Leppard<b5_0/> released their second album <a1_0><b6_0>High 'n' Dry<b6_0/><a1_0/>, mixing glam-rock with heavy metal, and helping to define the sound of hard rock for the decade. The follow-up <b7_0>Pyromania<b7_0/> (1983), reached number two on the American charts and the singles <a2_0>"Photograph", "Rock of Ages" and "Foolin'"<a2_0/>, helped by the emergence of MTV, all reached the Top 40. It was widely emulated, particularly by the emerging Californian glam metal scene. This was followed by US acts like Mötley Crüe, with their albums Too Fast for Love (<b8_0>1981<b8_0/>) and Shout at the Devil (<a4_0>1983<a4_0/>) and, as the style grew, the arrival of bands such as Ratt, White Lion, Twisted Sister and Quiet Riot. <a3_0>Quiet Riot<a3_0/>'s album <b9_0>Metal Health<b9_0/> (1983) was the first glam metal album, and arguably the first heavy metal album of any kind, to reach number one in the Billboard music charts and helped open the doors for mainstream success by subsequent bands.
